result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vang Xiong

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Violation Report. Filed by JusticePoint - C Amundson.
Defendant Record Update
Matter set for a PTC on 12/05/2022 at 9:00 a.m.
Status Report from JusticePoint dated 10/28/22
Violation Report from JusticePoint dated 10/14/22
Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:53 PM Defendant Vang Xiong in court.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Vang Xiong. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases 21CF310, 22CF235, and 22CF303.
State requests warrants be quashed.
BY THE COURT: Warrants are quashed and bonds are reinstated.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:49 AM Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Vang Xiong.  Attorney Gary Kryshak in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard: 21CF310, 22CF235, 22CF303.
Atty Dodge states the appearances.

Based on non-appearance of the defendant, State is requesting a body only warrant.
Court questions Atty Kryshak.

Court reviews the file and states findings for the record. 

BY THE COURT: Court issues a body only warrant for all 3 cases.
Violation Report from JusticePoint dated 09/08/22
Status Report from JusticePoint dated 09/09/22
filed by Atty Gary Kryshak
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing filed by Atty Gary Kryshak
Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant received copy of information on both cases.
Defendant waives reading of information on both cases.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered for both cases. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued on each case.

3:17 PM Defendant Vang Xiong in court.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Vang Xiong.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler appears on behalf of Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF235 & 22CF303.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status Report from JusticePoint dated 08/19/22
Defendant Record Update
Day Report Program Status Report - Condition of Bond. Filed by JusticePoint- C Amundson.
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney /s/ PB 07/22/22 nunc pro tunc 07/11/22
Preliminary hearing on August 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Wage Assignment to S&P General Contractors for Repayment of Attorney Fees in the Amount of $50/Month
Cover Letter to S&P General Contractors

2:17 PM Defendant Vang Xiong in court.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Vang Xiong.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF235 & 22CF303.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint on both cases.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held on both cases.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Court questions the defendant with regards to his employment. 
Defendant is informed that he will need to reimburse the county for attorney fees.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Wage Assignment to be completed for $50/month for repayment of attorney fees.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Atty Gary Kryshak

2:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Vang Xiong in court.  Attorney (Atty) Erik John Mcfarland in court for Vang Xiong. Cases 21CF310 and 22CF235.
Atty McFarland states he doesn't represent him on cases 22CF303 and 22CF235.
Court appoints Atty Kryshak as court appointed counsel since the public defender has been unable to get an attorney and there is a conflict with Atty McFarland.
Atty Kryshak will let the court know if he has any conflicts to represent the defendant.

22CF303 and 22CF235 are set for:  07-18-22 at 1:30 pm initial appearances.
21CF310 is set for a pretrial conference 08-08-22 at 10:00 am
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
July 18, 2022 at 2:00 PM

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances. 
Comply with all conditions of all other bonds and if that means day report, he has to day report.

1:23 PM Defendant Vang Xiong appeared by video, in custody from the Portage County jail.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Vang Xiong.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine, Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, Bail Jumping. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.  

Court questions the defendant if Atty McFarland represents him on other matters. 
Defendant responds. 
Atty Bergner indicates the defendant is eligible for public defender representation but not sure of current representation.

State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Court questions Atty Mutchler if the defendant is in the Pre-Trial Supervision Program. 
Defendant responds, has no way to contact them every day.  
Atty Bergner does not have any objections as to bond. 

Defendant asks to get his phone back so he can call for day reporting. 
Court informs the defendant to speak to his attorney about those things.
Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
